name: bohea
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
a type of black tea from China, often considered to be of low quality and mainly drunk in the eighteenth and nineteenth centuries : We were provided with the minimum of refreshment, such as weak bohea, thinly-cut bread and butter, and not-very-fresh cake. Bohea tea is the favourite beverage here.
More examplesFewer examplesI drink a cup of bohea or green tea almost every morning.She woke to find a cup of steaming bohea by her pillow.No one ever gossiped, even when they were alone in the kitchen or sipping bohea in the parlour.
